title: Letterhead, The Proctor & Gamble Company, Cinncinati, early–mid-20th century
medium: Letterhead: blue ink and gray ink on offwhite wove paper
markings: Proctor& Gamble logo, with "PROCTOR & GAMBLE" name above; 'ESTABLISHED 1837' below
inscribed: Imprinted at top (to right of logo): THE PROCTER & GAMBLE COMPANY.  Imprinted (below logo - as a second line in small typeface size), upper  left: GENERAL OFFICES; and imprinted (as a second line) at upper right: P.O.BOX 599 CINCINNATI, OHIO 45201
description: The Proctor& Gamble logo (at upper left) shows a bearded man in profile (the man in the moon) defining the crescent/ right side of a circle, and thirteen stars on a striped background (hints at the flag and patriotism).  Company name centered across top of sheet (to the right of the logo); company address as second line, at upper right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Letterhead, The Proctor & Gamble Company, Cinncinati, early–mid-20th century. Letterhead: blue ink and gray ink on offwhite wove paper. 
Gift of Thomas F. O'Malley. 1998-64-7
